Mengenal Sosok Celebrity Chef Pertama di Dunia yang Meninggal Tragis
05 Nov 2019, 06:55 by Andi Annisa Dwi Rahmawati - detikFood


Foto: Istimewa

Jakarta - Celebrity chef atau chef selebriti sangat menjamur sekarang. Tapi siapakah sosok celebrity chef pertama di dunia? Ternyata profesi ini sudah ada ratusan tahun lalu.Celebrity chef merujuk pada profesi chef yang dikenal luas masyarakat. Zaman sekarang celebrity chef tampil di televisi atau memiliki acara masak sendiri di media sosial. Berkat kemampuan masak dan karakter yang menarik, celebrity chef jadi populer di kalangan masyarakat.Tak jarang, celebrity chef memiliki basis penggemar yang besar. Mereka disukai dengan ciri khas masing-masing. Misalnya Gordon Ramsay yang tampak sangar sebagai juri kompetisi masak di Inggris. Meski begitu, Ramsay digemari karena merupakan sosok chef handal dan komentator kocak hasil masakan netizen.Menilik sejarahnya, celebrity chef sebenarnya bukan profesi baru. Sudah sejak tahun 1800-an profesi ini ada di dunia. Lantas siapakah sosok celebrity chef pertama? detikFood merangkum informasinya seperti dikutip dari Mashed (5/11) berikut. (adr/odi)


Foto: Istimewa

1. Sosok celebrity chef pertama di duniaAdalah Marie-Antoine Carême, pria Prancis kelahiran 8 Juni 1784 yang disebut-sebut sebagai sosok celebrity chef pertama di dunia. Carême lahir dari keluarga sangat miskin dengan jumlah saudara mencapai 15 sampai 25 orang. Ia lalu diusir ayahnya dari rumah saat masih 10 tahun.Carême yang kelaparan dan tak punya rumah kemudian memulai karir pertamanya di dapur. Ia jadi tukang cuci piring dan pesuruh untuk kedai minuman bernama Fricassee de Lapin di Paris. Enam tahun berlalu ia pindah bekerja ke toko roti milik salah satu pastry chef terkenal saat itu, Sylvain Bailly.Hal ini merupakan pencapaian penting dalam karir Carême sebab toko roti ini melayani kaum-kaum elit. Setiap tokoh kelas atas yang bersantap di sana menantikan hal-hal mewah baru yang dihadirkan toko roti tempat Carême bekerja.

(adr/odi)



Foto: Istimewa

2. Diajari Sylvain BaillyBailly adalah sosok yang mengajarkan Carême banyak hal. Mulai dari memanggang roti, pastry, membaca, sampai menulis. Karena bakatnya yang menonjol, tahun 1804 Carême diajak bekerja sama oleh diplomat Prancis bernama Charles Maurice de Talleyrand-Perigord. Ia yang memiliki koneksi luas menantang Carême untuk melihat seberapa layak kemampuan yang dimilikinya.Pertama Carême diminta menyiapkan daftar menu lengkap untuk disajikan di tempat tinggal pribadinya. Syaratnya, menu itu harus untuk satu tahun, tidak boleh ada menu yang berulang, dan harus fokus memakai bahan-bahan lokal serta sesuai musim.Carême berhasil menaklukan tantangan itu hingga ia 'masuk' ke dunia masak untuk kelas elit baru Prancis. Tahun 1810, Carême akhirnya dibawa ke dapur Napoleon di Tuileries. Ia semakin terkenal hingga ditugaskan membuat kue pernikahan Napoleon dan Marie-Louise dari Austria.

(adr/odi)



Foto: Istimewa

3. Carême memasarkan dirinya sendiriCarême dikenal masyarakat luas sekitar tahun 1815. Saat itu ia menjadi bagian penting dari acara-acara besar di Prancis, termasuk menyiapkan pesta untuk 10.000 veteran. Di tahun yang sama ia juga mengeluarkan buku masak.Tak hanya berisi resep, Carême memasukkan sketsa fotonya sendiri. Hal ini merupakan upaya untuk memastikan banyak orang tahu sosok dirinya. Ia juga semakin menjalin hubungan baik dengan orang-orang penting seperti Chopin, Victor Hugo, dan komposer Rossini.Carême dinilai sangat pintar dalam memasarkan dirinya. Ia tak hanya sukses jadi chef, tapi juga penulis buku resep. Karirnya di dunia kuliner pun semakin cemerlang.

(adr/odi)



Foto: Istimewa

4. Carême mengajarkan pentingnya presentasi makananCarême disebut-sebut sebagai sosok yang sangat mementingkan kualitas makanan. Tak hanya rasa makanan yang enak, ia juga meminta agar presentasi makanan harus cantik. Ia menulis, "Saya ingin memesan dan mencicipi. Makanan yang ditampilkan dengan baik meningkat 100 persen di mata saya."Kontribusi Carême pada kuliner Prancis juga dianggap penting. Ia disebut-sebut sebagai salah satu pendiri gastronomi Prancis. Ia juga bantu memperkenalkan makanan Prancis ke Inggris.Tahun 1815 ia berkunjung ke sana untuk menjadi chef di kediaman King George IV. Carême membuat banyak menu yang disukai anggota kerajaan. Misalnya saja "Marinaded haunch of boar," "Great Parisian meringue," "Ducklings Luxembourg," dan ragam dessert.

(adr/odi)



Foto: Istimewa

5. Meninggal tragisDi balik karir cemerlangnya, Carême meninggal tragis di usia muda. Catatan dokter menyebut Carême mengalami TBC usus. Namun kenyataannya sangat jauh berbeda.Carême habiskan waktu bertahun-tahun di dapur yang memakai api batu bara. Di dapur tersebut juga tak ada ventilasi sehingga udara dan asap terperangkap. Ia alami keracunan karbon monoksida ringan.Pada 12 Januari 1833, Carême alami stroke karena aktivitas beratnya selama di dapur. Ia akhirnya meninggal di usia 49 tahun. Carême meninggalkan banyak warisan penting, termasuk kata-katanya untuk mereka yang mau mengikuti jejak Carême."Nasihat untuk chef muda: orang-orang muda yang mencintai seni Anda; memiliki keberanian, ketekunan... selalu berharap... jangan mengandalkan siapa pun, yakin dengan diri Anda sendiri, dengan bakat dan kejujuran Anda dan semuanya akan baik-baik saja," ungkap Carême.

(adr/odi)
text:
Get to know the figure of the world's first celebrity chef who died tragically
05 Nov 2019, 06:55 by Andi Annisa Dwi Rahmawati - detikFood


Photo: Special

Jakarta - Celebrity chefs or celebrity chefs are mushrooming now. But who is the first celebrity chef in the world? It turns out that this profession existed hundreds of years ago. Celebrity chef refers to the chef profession that is widely known by the public. Nowadays celebrity chefs appear on television or have their own cooking shows on social media. Thanks to the ability to cook and interesting characters, celebrity chefs become popular among the people. Not infrequently, celebrity chefs have a large fan base. They are liked by their respective characteristics. For example Gordon Ramsay who looks fierce as a judge of cooking competitions in England. Even so, Ramsay is popular because he is a reliable chef and hilarious commentator of netizens' cooking. Given his history, celebrity chef is actually not a new profession. Already in the 1800s this profession existed in the world. So who is the first celebrity chef? detikFood summarizes the information as quoted from Mashed (5/11) follows. (adr / odi)


Photo: Special

1. The figure of the first celebrity chef in the world Is Marie-Antoine Carême, a French man born June 8, 1784 who is said to be the figure of the first celebrity chef in the world. Carême was born to a very poor family with 15 to 25 siblings. He was then expelled by his father from home when he was 10 years old. Caramel who was starving and homeless then started his first career in the kitchen. He became a dishwasher and messenger for a tavern named Fricassee de Lapin in Paris. Six years later he moved to work at a bakery owned by one of the famous pastry chefs at the time, Sylvain Bailly. This was an important achievement in Carême's career because the bakery served the elite. Every high-class figure who ate there looked forward to the new luxury presented by the bakery where Carême worked.

(adr / odi)



Photo: Special

2. Taught by Sylvain Bailly Bailly is a person who teaches Carême many things. Starting from baking bread, pastry, reading, to writing. Because of his outstanding talent, in 1804 Carême was invited to work together by a French diplomat named Charles Maurice de Talleyrand-Perigord. He who has extensive connections challenges Carême to see how worthy his abilities are. First Carême is asked to prepare a complete menu list to be served in his private residence. The condition is that the menu must be for one year, there must be no repetitive menus, and must focus on using local ingredients and according to the season. Carême managed to conquer the challenge until he 'entered' the cooking world for a new elite class of France. In 1810, Carême was finally taken to Napoleon's kitchen in the Tuileries. He became increasingly famous until assigned to make wedding cakes Napoleon and Marie-Louise from Austria.

(adr / odi)



Photo: Special

3. Carême markets itself. Carême was known to the wider community around 1815. At that time he became an important part of major events in France, including preparing a party for 10,000 veterans. In the same year he also issued a cookbook. Not only containing recipes, Carême included a sketch of his own photo. This is an effort to ensure that many people know who he is. He also increasingly established good relations with important people such as Chopin, Victor Hugo, and composer Rossini.Carême considered to be very smart in marketing himself. He is not only successful as a chef, but also a recipe book writer. His career in the culinary world was even brighter.

(adr / odi)



Photo: Special

4. Carême teaches the importance of food presentation Carême is said to be a figure who is very concerned about the quality of food. Not only does the food taste good, he also asks that the food presentation must be beautiful. He wrote, "I want to order and taste. Well-displayed food has increased 100 percent in my eyes." Carême's contribution to French cuisine is also considered important. He is touted as one of the founders of French gastronomy. He also helped introduce French food to England. In 1815 he visited there to become a chef at the residence of King George IV. Carême makes many menus that royal members like. For example, "Marinaded haunch of boar," "Great Parisian meringue," "Luxembourg Ducklings," and a variety of desserts.

(adr / odi)



Photo: Special

5. Died tragically Behind his brilliant career, Carême died tragically at a young age. Doctors note that Carême has intestinal tuberculosis. But the reality is very much different. Carême spent years in the kitchen using coal fire. In the kitchen there is also no ventilation so that air and smoke are trapped. He experienced mild carbon monoxide poisoning. On January 12, 1833, Carême suffered a stroke due to strenuous activity while in the kitchen. He finally died at the age of 49 years. Carême leaves many important legacies, including words for those who want to follow in Carême's footsteps. "Advice for young chefs: young people who love your art; have courage, perseverance ... always hope ... don't count on anyone, believe in yourself, with your talent and honesty and everything will be fine, "Carême said.

(adr / odi)
